metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4954 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The process_packet function in ntp_proto.c in ntpd in NTP 4.x before 4.2.8p8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (peer-variable modification) by sending spoofed packets from many source IP addresses in a certain scenario, as demonstrated by triggering an incorrect leap indication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10').
